title: Experiments in Generative Art
text: I have been working on a new project that combines knot theory with music.

title: Experiments in Generative Art
text:
The Concept
We are looking for a way to visualize the “interface” between geometric forms and organic forms.

title: Experiments in Generative Art
text:
The Code
Here is a snippet of the Wolfram Language1 code I am using:
Table[Style[k, Hue[k/20]], {k, 1, 20}]





flowchart LR
  A[Hard edge] --> B(Round edge)
  B --> C{Decision}
  C --> D[Result one]
  C --> E[Result two]

title: Experiments in Generative Art
text:
The Math
The core of the structure relies on the flow polytope equation:
\[\mathcal{F}_G = \left\{ x \in \mathbb{R}^E : \sum_{e \in \text{in}(v)} x_e = \sum_{e \in \text{out}(v)} x_e \right\}\]






Note



Note that there are five types of callouts, including: note, tip, warning, caution, and important.








Tip



Note that there are five types of callouts, including: note, tip, warning, caution, and important.








Warning



Note that there are five types of callouts, including: note, tip, warning, caution, and important.








Caution



Note that there are five types of callouts, including: note, tip, warning, caution, and important.








Important



Note that there are five types of callouts, including: note, tip, warning, caution, and important.

title: Experiments in Generative Art
text:
Footnotes


Hey wait I can make a footnote!
And if I want the footnote to be multiple lines I can do that too.↩︎

title: New Year, New Site
text:
Welcome to the new hanusa.xyz. In 2025, Queens College transitioned all its webpages away from the college infrastructure. So I set up hanusa.xyz to be my index.html away from home. I’ve taken the time to redevelop the site to be more reflective of the breadth of the work that I do in my job.





The site is hosted on Github Pages, and was developed with the help of Google Gemini.
Furthermore, the blog feature is built on Quarto, which allows for built in \(\LaTeX\) code \[\sum_{i=1}^\infty \textup{Wow_i!}.\]






Note



Quarto has a lot of built in features, including these callouts!
